snippet: Alcoa benefited from strong demand for aluminum for cars and planes, which it predicted would continue.
abstract: Alcoa reports larger-than-expected first-quarter profit, benefiting from strong demand for aluminum for automobiles and airplanes, which it predicts will continue; profit was $149 million, or 13 cents a share, up 58 percent from $94 million, or 9 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 3 percent to $5.83 billion from $6.01 billion.
lead_paragraph: Alcoa benefited from strong demand for aluminum for cars and planes, which it predicted would continue.

headline.seo: Alcoa Reports Profit Up 58%, Exceeding Analysts’ Forecast
headline.main: Alcoa Reports Profit Up 58%, Exceeding Analysts’ Forecast
headline.print_headline: Alcoa Reports Profit Up 58%, Exceeding Analysts’ Forecast
